overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second and fifth circuits and require the third circuit of the judiciary and big island drug court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program in the third circuit. [3] The measure was amended by changing the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4] This Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [3]
appropriations: The measure inserts an appropriation for the Department of Health for the women's court pilot program, including the establishment of positions. [4] The Committee on Finance is requested to consider an appropriation amount of $801,802 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) to the Department of Health. [4] This includes $145,000 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary clinical psychologist position, $76,788 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary social worker/human services professional IV position, and $45,216 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary social services assistant V position. [4]
assumptions_and_methodology: The measure was amended by deleting language that would have established a three-year women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and instead requiring the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to study and submit a report. [4] This modification is based on testimony that the circuit courts on the Big Island are unable to manage another stand-alone specialty treatment court. [2] The Department of Health's requested budget of $801,802 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) is based on the Department’s staffing requirements for the operation of the existing Women’s Court pilot project of the First Circuit. [2]
agency_impact: There shall be established within the second and fifth circuits of the judiciary the women's court pilot program. [3] The third circuit of the judiciary and big island drug court shall conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program in the third circuit. [3] An appropriation for the women's court pilot program will be expended by the department of health. [3]
policy_impact: This measure was amended by deleting language that would have established a three-year women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit of the Judiciary. [4] It now requires the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study and submit a report on establishing a women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit. [4] The effective date was changed to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4]
revenue_sources: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii an unspecified sum for the judiciary and a separate unspecified sum for the department of health for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. [3] [3] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary and the department of health for the purposes of this Act. [3] [3]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The measure inserts an appropriation for the Department of Health for the women's court pilot program, including the establishment of positions, for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027. [3] [4] The Committee on Finance has been requested to consider an appropriation amount of $801,802 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) to the Department of Health. [4] This appropriation would include $145,000 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary clinical psychologist position, $76,788 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary social worker/human services professional IV position, and $45,216 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary social services assistant V position. [4] The number of temporary staff positions established in the Judiciary has been changed to an unspecified amount. [4] The judiciary is required to submit annual reports on the pilot program prior to the convening of the regular sessions of 2026, 2027, and 2028. [3] The third circuit of the judiciary shall submit a report of its findings from the interim study to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of the regular session of 2026. [3]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The bill was amended to establish the three-year women's court pilot program in the Second and Fifth Circuits, removing the Third Circuit. [4] The Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court are now required to conduct an interim study and submit a report on establishing a women's court pilot program. [4] The bill now includes an appropriation to the Department of Health for the pilot program and the establishment of positions. [4] The Committee on Finance is requested to consider an appropriation of $801,802 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) to the Department of Health for specific temporary positions. [4] The effective date has been amended to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4]
